poem:
Title: "Bayou Binding"

Louisiana's morning, all swamp and sorrow,
Legislation, a silent gunman's arrow.
Two pills of choice, now contraband,
In this hot, haunted southern land.
Abort consumption, or don the stripes,
Brood in cells, life's cruel types.
Deep South, oh Deep South, alligator tears,
When will you birth hope, not fears?
